title-group.article-title: Application of Stainless Steel in Crash Structures of Vehicles

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 2005 Society of Automotive Engineers, Inc.

abstract.p: Besides their corrosion resistance the outstanding mechanical properties, especially their high strength and their excellent forming capabilites, qualify stainless steel materials for the use in crash structures of vehicles. In the paper the lightweight potential of vehicle crash structures due to the use of stainless steel is demonstrated. Therefore the mechanical properties of stainless steel are described. Then an analysis of the weight reduction of the side members and the crossmember due to the use of stainless steel of a caravan vehicle is presented. The study considers a high speed crash and a pedestrian protection loadcase.

ref.mixed-citation: Cunat, P.-J.: "A new Structural Material for Passenger Cars: Stainless Steel", 10. Aachener Kolloquium Fahrzeug-und Motorentechnik 2001, Aachen, 2001

European Commission: 111/5021/96 EN, "Draft Proposal for a European Parliament and Council Directive Relating to the Protection of Pedestrians and other Road Users in the Event of a Collision with a Motor Vehicle", Brussels, February 1996
Friesen, F.: „Erfahrungen mit Modifikationen der Fahrzeugfront zur Erhöhung des Fußgänger- schutzes", Tagung Schutz der Fußgänger bei Kollisionen mit PKW, Haus der Technik, München, 2001
